Directions
Adjust oven rack to middle position and preheat oven to 350ºF (175ºC).
In a large bowl, toss bread with olive oil, salt, and pepper to evenly coat. Transfer to a rimmed baking sheet and spread into an even layer. Bake, stirring every 5 minutes, until croutons are golden brown and crisp, about 20 minutes.
Serious Eats / Amanda Suarez
Remove croutons from oven and cool completely at room temperature before serving or storing.
Serious Eats / Amanda Suarez
Variations
Parmesan croutons:
Adjust oven rack to middle position and preheat oven to 325ºF (162ºC). (This lower temperature than the temp for plain croutons is to prevent the cheese from burning.)
In a large bowl, toss bread with olive oil, salt, pepper, and 6 tablespoons (40g) Parmigiano-Reggiano to evenly coat. Transfer to a rimmed baking sheet and bake, stirring occasionally, until croutons are golden brown and crisp, 25 to 30 minutes. Remove croutons from oven and allow to cool completely.
Serious Eats / Amanda Suarez
Special Equipment
Rimmed baking sheet
Make-Ahead and Storage
The croutons can be kept in an airtight container at room temperature for up to 1 week.
